outputs.output_descr:
The project will provide support towards advocacy, strategic policy advice and capacity development to targeted institutions for disaster risk reduction (DRR).

Aware of the need to strengthen national capacities for disaster management, support will focus on increasing Ghana's resilience to natural and man-made hazards, by:
-	enhancing capacity at the district level in the areas of DRR and disaster preparedness, in order to: scale up support to enhance awareness creation and DRR mainstreaming at the local level; improve capacity of districts to timely and effectively respond to emergencies; provide knowledge and tools to local artisans/masons and district officers to promote a sustainable and disaster resilient housing infrastructure.
-	Mainstreaming DRR into national building regulations, through the revision and adoption of the National Building Guide.

Accra experienced heavy rainfall on October 25-26 causing flash floods in many part of the city.  This led to the death of 9 people, severe damage of road infrastructure, disruption of electricity supply and serious health concerns.  With ongoing coordination by the office of the Resident Coordinator in collaboration with the Government the urgent humanitarian and lifesaving interventions are underway.  With the immediate support from BCPR, the proposed project will strive to clean and dredge critical drains, enhancing the capacity to mobilizing communities and volunteers and to establish public private partnership

project_descr: Strengthening national institution capacity for disaster risk reduction and management
project_title: Support to Integrate Disaster Risk Reduction
